1:
When you sit down to eat a meal with ruler of a country,
\q2 think carefully about what is in front of you.
\q1
2:
It is said, "put a knife to your throat" if you think of eating a lot of food, 
\q2 because it would be foolish to eat too much at such an important event. 
\q1
5:
As soon as you look at the money, it will be gone;
\q2 it will be as if it suddenly took up wings 
\q2 and flew up like an eagle, up into the sky.
\q1
6:
Do not eat with an evil man—he will gaze at your food for a long time—
\q2 do not desire his fine food,
\q1
7:
because he will be thinking about how much your food cost him, 
\q2 and he will say to you, "Eat and drink," 
\q2 but that is not what he will really be thinking.
\q1
11:
because the One who redeems them is strong, 
\q2 and he will plead their case against you.
\q1
12:
Pay attention to what you are learning,
\q2 and listen to the words of knowledge. 
\q1
14:
and if you beat them with the rod of discipline, 
\q2 you may save their lives from death.
\q1
15:
My son, if you have taken wisdom deep within yourself,
\q2 I will be very happy,
\q1
16:
and I will be sincerely glad 
\q2 when you say what is right. 
\q1
18:
If you respect him, you will have a life in the future, 
\q2 and Yahweh will not cut off his promises for the future.
\q1
19:
My son, listen to me so you may become wise,
\q2 and think about the way you live your life.
\q1
20:
Do not associate with those who get drunk with wine,
\q2 or with those who are eat far too much food,
\q1
22:
Pay attention to your father who brought you into the world, 
\q2 and do not hate your mother when she is old.
\q1
25:
Make your father and mother proud, 
\q2 and let your mother be glad. 
\q1
26:
My son, take what I say and put it deep within you, 
\q2 and pay attention to the way that I live. 
\q1
29:
Who is it who had trouble? Who has sorrows? Who has conflicts and fights?
\q2 Who has quarreling? Who is wounded for no reason?
\q2 Whose eyes are always bloodshot because they drank too much or ate too much?
\q1
30:
It is those who drink too much wine
\q2 and those who drink the mixed wine.
\q1
31:
Do not look with pleasure at red wine when it sparkles in the cup,
\q2 and it goes down the throat smoothly.
\q1
32:
But, in the last, it bites you like a poisonous snake .
\q1
33:
It makes you see strange things, 
\q2 and within you, you say perverse things when you are drunk. 
\q
35:
You will say, "I think that someone struck me, but he did not hurt me;
\q2 They beat me, but I did not feel it.
\q1 When will I wake up
\q2 in order that I can drink some more wine?"
